System.Obsolete("This class has been deprecated. Please use the System.Web.Mobile.DeviceFiltersSection class instead. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Reads the [deviceFilters Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/2fb323b9-675b-48de-861b-8998fa0c51ba) section of a configuration file that specifies the set of device filters for use with ASP.NET mobile controls. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

block.para: Instances of classes that inherit the class must be thread safe and stateless. The method must be callable from multiple threads simultaneously. See for more information about inheriting.

Docs.related: Introduction to Mobile Application Development in ASP.NET

Docs.param: The parent node in the configuration file, or ( in Visual Basic) if creating the parent node.
Docs.summary: Creates a dictionary of the device filter information contained in the specified by the parameter. If the object referenced by the property is not , then dictionary entries are appended to the parent dictionary. This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.returns: A dictionary of the device filter information contained in the specified .
